instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2251: What is A2251? A2251 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3348, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01949..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal image. External OK
threads.message:
Hi,

Board has no water damage, no kick compomonents i can see, just stoped working internal display. Tried good know LCD panel and still not working. External monitor is ok, all other functions of MBP are ok too.
What it can be?



P.S:
<CHIP>U8510</CHIP>,  <CHIP>U8500</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8501</CHIP> supplies seems to be ok.


DEAD CPU for internal image?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal image. External OK
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on EDP_INT_ lines.
Compare with good board, if possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal image. External OK
threads.message: All <SIGNAL>EDP_INT</SIGNAL> lines are about 0.330-0.350. Actually i have no board to check it. Checked same lines on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and the value is 0.450.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal image. External OK
